metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2590 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in ipa before 4.4. IdM's ca-del, ca-disable, andca-enable commands did not properly check the user's permissions whilemodifying CAs in Dogtag. An authenticated, unauthorized attacker could usethis flaw to delete, disable, or enable CAs causing various denial ofservice problems with certificate issuance, OCSP signing, and deletion ofsecret keys.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2590` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freeipa-admintools - 4.7.0~pre1+git20180411-2ubuntu2
freeipa-client - 4.7.0~pre1+git20180411-2ubuntu2
freeipa-common - 4.7.0~pre1+git20180411-2ubuntu2
freeipa-server - 4.7.0~pre1+git20180411-2ubuntu2
freeipa-server-dns - 4.7.0~pre1+git20180411-2ubuntu2
freeipa-server-trust-ad - 4.7.0~pre1+git20180411-2ubuntu2
freeipa-tests - 4.7.0~pre1+git20180411-2ubuntu2
python-ipaclient - 4.7.0~pre1+git20180411-2ubuntu2
python-ipalib - 4.7.0~pre1+git20180411-2ubuntu2
python-ipaserver - 4.7.0~pre1+git20180411-2ubuntu2
python-ipatests - 4.7.0~pre1+git20180411-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freeipa package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.7.0~pre1+git20180411-2ubuntu2').
